com.abdulrhmanil.wallhavenwallpapers

Class DisplayUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.abdulrhmanil.wallhavenwallpapers.DisplayUtil

  • public class DisplayUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Display utility class that help us to calculate the dimension of thumb photos, and the number of the thumb photos that should be in one row/line. This class provide getThumbRes, getThumbRes methods. that return an instance of type ThumbRes that contain 3 variables. thus 3 variables is result of the calculation. This class is have 3 constant values : witch it the minimum width, height of the photo, and the side margin of the thumb photo. Thus constants could change ...

    • Method Detail

      • getThumbRes

        public static DisplayUtil.ThumbRes getThumbRes(android.content.Context context)
        Return ThumbRes instance that hold 3 final variables 1 - the supposed width of the thump photo. 2 - the supposed height of the thump photo. 3 - the number of thumb photos in on row or in one line. Thous final variables calculated, depends on the height, width and the resolution of the screen. The methodology is we trying to put max number of thumb photos in one line, when the minimum width x height of the thumb photo is 300x200 with padding 8 DP. and remaining space we scale the thumb photos in that space.
        Parameters:
        context - a context.
        Returns:
        Return ThumbRes instance, that contain number of thumb photos in one line, the supposed width of the thump photo, the supposed height of the thump photo.

      • getThumbRes

        public static DisplayUtil.ThumbRes getThumbRes(android.content.Context context,
                                               int thumbWidthDp,
                                               int thumbMarginWidthDp,
                                               int thumbHeightDp)
        Return ThumbRes instance that hold 3 final variables 1 - the supposed width of the thump photo. 2 - the supposed height of the thump photo. 3 - the number of thumb photos in on row or in one line. Thous final variables calculated, depends on the height, width and the resolution of the screen. The methodology is we trying to put max number of thumb photos in one line, when the minimum resolution is : thumbWidthDp x thumbHeightDp and sides margin of thumbMarginWidthDp. and remaining space we divide it between photos and scale them in that space.
        Parameters:
        context - a context.
        thumbWidthDp - is minimum width allowed for each thumb photo.
        thumbMarginWidthDp - is the margin of each thumb photo from each side.
        thumbHeightDp - is minimum height allowed for each thumb photo.
        Returns:
        Return ThumbRes instance, that contain number of thumb photos in one line, the supposed width of the thump photo, the supposed height of the thump photo.
